properties.title: Deploy Zero Trust Storage for FSLogix (AVD)

elements.name: shareName
elements.label: File Share Name
elements.toolTip: Enter a name for the File Share value. This will be the 2nd half of the UNC Share Name. (i.e. \storageaccount ilesharename)

constraints.validationMessage: Must be between 3 and 64 characters long, alpha-numeric,all lowercase and can contain hyphens. (non-consecutive)

elements.name: shareSize
elements.label: Share Size
elements.toolTip: Set the Size in GB for the Share.

options.text: REMINDER: Premium Storage costs are based on allocated size where as Standard Storage is based on ammount used. However, in large scale deployments it's best to consider Premium with the auto-increase solution to gain the additional performance needed. Click this box for more infromation on the Auto-Increase Quota solution.

elements.name: pvtDNSZoneSub
elements.label: Private DNS Zone Subscription
elements.toolTip: Choose the subscription where the Private DNS Zone resides.

elements.name: pvtDNSZone
elements.label: Private DNS Zone (File)
elements.toolTip: Select the Private DNS Zone to use for the Storage Private Link. It's recommended to have a central Private DNS Zone for all files based records in a hub type subscription or resource group.

elements.name: pvtDNSZoneKV
elements.label: Private DNS Zone (VaultCore)
elements.toolTip: Select the Private DNS Zone to use for the KeyVault Private Link. It's recommended to have a central Private DNS Zone for all files based records in a hub type subscription or resource group.

options.text:
The Private DNS Zone must already be configured and you MUST select a 'FILE' based zone for Azure Files.
Additionally, for On-Prem resources to resolve the storage please click this box for more details.

elements.name: identityName
elements.label: User Managed Identity Name
elements.toolTip: Type in a name for the User Managed Identity to be created which must be between 3 and 24 characters long, alpha-numeric and can contain hyphens.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be between 3 and 24 characters long, alpha-numeric and can contain hyphens. (non-consecutive)

elements.name: keyVaultName
elements.label: Key Vault Name
elements.toolTip: Type in a name for the Key Vault to be used for encryption of the Storage Account using a created Customer Managed Key

constraints.validationMessage: Must be between 3 and 24 characters long, alpha-numeric and can contain hyphens. (non-consecutive)

elements.name: DomainName
elements.label: Domain Name
elements.toolTip: Provide identity service domain name.

elements.name: OUPathStorage
elements.label: OU Path for Storage Account
elements.toolTip: It's best to consider an OU with no or limited Group Policies for initial deployments. This value should be the distinguished name of the OU.

elements.name: groupUsersName
elements.label: AVD Users Group
elements.toolTip: Provide the name of the group that will be used for the AVD Users. This group will be used to set the NTFS Permissions on the File Share.

elements.name: groupAdminsName
elements.label: AVD Admins Group
elements.toolTip: Provide the name of the group that will be used for the AVD Admins. This group will be used to set the NTFS Permissions on the File Share.

elements.name: DomainUser
elements.label: Username (UPN Format)
elements.toolTip: Provide username with permissions to join session host to the domain.

elements.name: optionDomainCredsKeyvault
elements.label: Use Keyvault for Credentials
elements.toolTip: Use credentials stored in an existing Keyvault.

elements.name: kvDomain
elements.label: Select Keyvault
elements.toolTip: Select Keyvault which contains the secrets for the Domain Credentials.

elements.name: kvDomainSecretName
elements.label: KeyVault Secret Name (Domain Credential)
elements.toolTip: The Name of the KeyVault secret that contains the encrypted password as a value.

elements.name: DomainPassword
elements.toolTip: Provide password for domain join account.

options.text: The Management VM is used to Domain Join the Storage Account using the provided credentials and set the NTFS Permissions. They will be based on the AVD Users and AVD Admins Groups provided. You can also click this box to see the recommended permissions for NTFS.

elements.name: vmName
elements.label: Management VM Name
elements.toolTip: Provide the name of the management VM.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be 1-15 characters and alphanumeric. Can contain hyphens. (non-consecutive)

elements.name: OUPathVm
elements.label: OU Path for Management VM
elements.toolTip: It's best to consider an OU with no or limited Group Policies for initial deployments. This value should be the distinguished name of the OU.

elements.name: subnet
elements.label: Subnet
elements.toolTip: Select an existing subnet with an existing Private DNS Zone for creating the file based Private Link.

elements.name: VmUsername
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Provide username for session host local admin account. Administrator can't be used as username, it is reserved by the system.

constraints.validationMessage: This username can't be used, it is a reserved word.

elements.name: optionLocalCredsKeyvault
elements.label: Use Keyvault for Credentials
elements.toolTip: Use credentials stored in an existing Keyvault.

elements.name: kvLocal
elements.label: Select Keyvault
elements.toolTip: Select Keyvault which contains the secrets for the Local Admin Credentials.

elements.name: kvLocalSecretName
elements.label: KeyVault Secret Name (Local Admin Credential)
elements.toolTip: The Name of the KeyVault secret that contains the encrypted password as a value.

toolTip.password: The password must be alphanumeric, contain at least 12 characters, have at least 1 letter,1 number and 1 special character.
